description: The package includes funding for radar systems, anti-tank mines and hundreds of thousands of drones.

description: As the race to secure a trade deal with the U.S. heats up, can India secure favourable terms compared to other emerging markets?

title: Tesla shares retreat following sharpest rally since 2013
description: After soaring 23% on Wednesday due to President Trump's pause on most new tariffs, Tesla shares dropped on Thursday along with the broader market.

title: Stocks Dive Again as Angst Rises Over Trump’s Trade War
description: The S&P 500 fell 3.5 percent by the closing bell, erasing part of Wednesday’s recovery, as fears grew that the worsening trade war with China would crimp growth.
author: The New York Times

title: After Trump’s Pause on Tariffs, EU Delays Retaliation to Allow Talks
description: The bloc had voted to impose retaliatory measures just before President Trump made his last-minute U-turn. It has now announced a postponement.
author: Jeanna Smialek

title: British Troops Could Be Deployed In Ukraine For 5 Years: Report
description: Britain is considering deploying troops to Ukraine for five years under plans being discussed by allies, The Telegraph reported on Friday, citing unnamed sources.

title: UK's Prince Harry Makes Surprise Visit To Ukraine
description: Prince Harry visited Ukraine on Thursday, a spokesperson said Thursday, becoming the second British royal to travel to the country since Russia's invasion in February 2022.

title: Trump’s tariff blitz could hardly have come at a worse time for China
description: Beijing is remaining defiant in the face of President Donald Trump’s trade measures, but it will have to take some sort of action to shore up its weak economy.
author: Lily Kuo

title: Irmgard Furchner, German secretary convicted of Nazi crimes, dies at 99
description: She was found guilty of being an accessory to more than 10,000 murders in one of the final efforts to bring legal justice to victims of the Holocaust.
author: Emily Langer

title: UK to co-host global conference with aim of resolving Sudan’s civil war
description: Foreign ministers will gather in London and seek to exert diplomatic pressure demanding a ceasefireThe British government is bringing together foreign ministers from nearly 20 countries and organisations in an attempt to establish a group that can drive the warring factions in Sudan closer towards peace.The conference at Lancaster House in London on 15 April comes on the second anniversary of the start of a civil war that has led to the world’s biggest humanitarian crisis, but has been persistently left at the bottom of the global list of diplomatic priorities. Half of Sudan’s population are judged to be desperately short of food, with 11 million people internally displaced. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: Revealed: Big tech’s new datacentres will take water from the world’s driest areas
description: Amazon, Google and Microsoft are building datacentres in water-scarce parts of five continentsAmazon, Microsoft and Google are operating datacentres that use vast amounts of water in some of the world’s driest areas and are building many more, the non-profit investigatory organisation SourceMaterial and the Guardian have found.With Donald Trump pledging to support them, the three technology giants are planning hundreds of datacentres in the US and across the globe, with a potentially huge impact on populations already living with water scarcity. Continue reading...
author: Luke Barratt, Costanza Gambarini and data graphics by Andrew Witherspoon and Aliya Uteuova

title: China outbuilding America in sky, sea, and space: US commander sounds alarm
author: TOI World Desk

title: Kilmar in El Salvador: Court orders Trump to undo deportation disaster
description: The Supreme Court told the Donald Trump administration to help Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia return. He was wrongly deported to El Salvador. The court did not order his direct return. A lower court will decide the next steps. Abrego Garcia had protection from deportation. He was deported despite the ruling. The case raises questions about immigration and executive power.
author: TOI World Desk
